title: (x) 'Transmorphosis': octogonal caps / Many imitators but none as nice... - Far-Marks {Mike Y}
content:
Any help in identitfying this font please!!?? I'm after the block sans serif one... not the serif. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202133223im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Boris_Spread_1_5138.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202133223im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Boris_Spread_One_5371.jpg)
author: acantwell

comments.content: It seems to be Octin College Heavy, a ripoff of ITC Machine.

At Linotype

[http://www.linotype.com/de/377918/octincollegeblack-schrift.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202133223/http:/www.linotype.com/de/377918/octincollegeblack-schrift.html "http://www.linotype.com/de/377918/octincollegeblack-schrift.html")

you have to pay for it.

At Dafont

[http://www.dafont.com/octin-college-free.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202133223/http:/www.dafont.com/octin-college-free.font "http://www.dafont.com/octin-college-free.font")

you get it for free.
Yeah that's close, but the S is definitely different... it may be a bespoke type?

That isn't Octin College. The M is far away from being identical. It isn’t [United](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202133223/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection/viewfonts) either but that gets you a bit closer (on the M).

Pixymbols [Far-Marks](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202133223/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/pixymbols/far-marks/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D34%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DTRANS-MORPHOSIS%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D27) seems to have about the right letterform shapes, if you add stroke and a lot of spacing between letters.

- Mike Yanega

Mike Yanega:

\> Pixymbols Far-Marks seems

That's it for sure. Good eye.
Octagonal lettering didn't begin with ITC Machine.

I recognised it from the first [Maxïmo Park](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202133223/http:/www.yesstudio.co.uk/view/maximo/archive) album campaign. According to London based studio YES, "...Maximus Bold was created for the project." The only difference I can see is that on the Maxïmo Park stuff they sometimes fill in the counter on the A. Maybe Far-Marks was used as a basis for the design.
